clinical_study.brief_title: Improving the Hospital-to-Home Transition Through Post-Discharge Virtual Visits in Primary Care
clinical_study.official_title: Improving the Hospital-to-Home Transition Through Post-Discharge Virtual Visits in Primary Care

lead_sponsor.agency: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

clinical_study.source: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test a new process for having a virtual visit with a primary care doctor after discharge from the hospital, instead of an in-person visit.

detailed_description.textblock: The goal of this project is to fully develop the protocol for identifying patients who would benefit from a virtual visit and develop the protocol for implementing the virtual visit. The value of this project is that the results will provide ample preliminary data for a future randomized controlled trial to determine the effectiveness of the intervention. This project will have an intervention group only. The hypothesis is that the intervention can be implemented in a way that is feasible and acceptable to providers and patients.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Per IRB COVID-19 guidance on conducting human subjects research

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients meeting inclusion criteria over the study period out of all patients being discharged over the same time period
Proportion of patients who consent to participate out of all those found to be eligible
Proportion of patients who successfully schedule video visits out of all of those who consent
Proportion of patients who successfully complete video visit out of all of those who scheduled

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient satisfaction with the video visit
secondary_outcome.description: Based on a previously validated instrument (Parmanto et. al, Int J Telerehab 2016 Spring; 8(1): 3-10). Measured through 5-point likert scale,free response, multiple choice, and yes/no questions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician satisfaction with the video visit
secondary_outcome.description: Measured through multiple choice, yes/no, and free-response (only asked if specific responses are received) questions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of in-person visits instead of or in addition to video visit

arm_group.description: Eligible patients will be given the option to consent to having one virtual visit with their primary care physician within four weeks after discharge from the hospital. Usual follow-up care will occur during this visit.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Medical inpatients, age >=18, with an existing WCIMA attending as his or her PCP
- Patients with disposition to home
- Medically appropriate for a video visit (as determined by inpatient attending)
- Patients or caregivers must be able to enroll in MyChart before discharge, must be capable of using the Weill Cornell Connect app to do a video visit at home using broadband access or the equivalent (must own a device compatible with the app, e.g.
smartphone or tablet)
- English speaking
- Cognitively able to participate or Caregiver must be able to participate
